properties.areaDesc: Pulaski, MO; Maries, MO; Miller, MO; Dallas, MO; Laclede, MO; Phelps, MO; Camden, MO
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 12:26PM CST until January 19 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Maries County in central Missouri...
Dallas County in southwestern Missouri...
Miller County in central Missouri...
Laclede County in southwestern Missouri...
Pulaski County in central Missouri...
Phelps County in east central Missouri...
Southeastern Camden County in central Missouri...

* Until 1230 AM CST Sunday.

* At 1224 PM CST, gauge reports indicated flooding across the area.
Up to one and a half inches of widespread rain fell yesterday and
last night. While no additional rain is expected, residual
flooding will continue through this evening.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the advisory include...
Rolla...                          Fort Leonard Wood...
Lebanon...                        Lake of The Ozarks State Park...
Ha Ha Tonka State Park...         Bennett Spring State Park...
Waynesville...                    Eldon...
Osage Beach...                    St. Robert...
St. James...                      Camdenton...
Buffalo...                        Village of Four Seasons...
Richland...                       Lake Ozark...
Dixon...                          Belle...
Morgan...                         Crocker...

This advisory includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route C north of Buffalo at Lindley Creek...
Route N at The Maries River east of Brinktown...
Route O at Jones Creek just south of Dixon...
Route HH in Tuscumbia...
and Route H, 3 miles northwest of Stoutland.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
